intro: Cyrtopera plantaginea, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and daisy-like white flowers with a yellow center. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Cyrtopera plantaginea is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
